description: From accelerate +â€Ž -ant (suffix forming agent nouns from verbs, or forming adjectives with senses of being prone or tending to do the actions of verbs).

adjectives.description: accelerant (comparative more accelerant, superlative most accelerant)

entries.meaning: Causing acceleration or speeding up; accelerating.

definitionGroups.group: (chemistry) Any substance that can bond or mix with, or disturb, another substance and cause an increase in the speed of a natural or artificial chemical process.

entries.meaning: In the context of fire protection, a substance that accelerates the development of a fire, especially some hydrocarbon-based fuel used to spread a fire caused by arson.
A substance used to catalyze the vulcanization of rubber.
(figurative) Something that speeds up a process or the uptake of something else.
